basics.name: Parham Saremi
basics.label: MSc Student at Mila | McGill University
basics.summary: Graduate student at Mila and McGill University supervised by Prof. Tal Arbel, with research interests in computer vision, generative modeling, and medical imaging.

work.name: Mila - Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute
work.summary: Conducting research in medical imaging and generative modeling under the supervision of Prof. Tal Arbel.
highlights: Exploring representation learning and generative modeling techniques for medical imaging applications.

work.name: ETH Zürich
work.summary: Worked on 3D reconstruction of human-object interactions from single monocular images.
highlights: Designed and implemented a pipeline integrating Pixel-aligned Implicit Functions, Vector Quantized-VAE, and Autoregressive Transformers.
Implemented the majority of the pipeline using Python and PyTorch.

work.name: EPFL - École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne
work.summary: Worked on human pose prediction with uncertainty modeling.
highlights: Developed a method that improved human pose prediction models by 2-5% across different datasets.
Implemented and maintained a deep learning library for human motion prediction.

work.name: UC Irvine
work.summary: Joint research with UC Irvine and Sharif University on cuisine prediction using multimodal data.
highlights: Developed a Transformer-based model for cuisine prediction combining visual and text-based features.

work.name: Imperial College London
highlights: Investigated novel methods for neural network verification under the supervision of Prof. Alessio Lomuscio.

work.name: CommaMed (formerly AIMed)
work.summary: Worked on preprocessing methods for the DDSM breast cancer dataset to enhance image quality.
highlights: Implemented preprocessing techniques to improve tumor visibility in medical images.

honors.title: Top 0.1% in Iranian Nationwide University Entrance Exam
honors.summary: Ranked 115th among 140,000+ participants in the Mathematics and Physics Discipline.
